channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2024060560
item.description:
Report X-2024060560

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: THEODORE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The outer pack said containers had vented caps and to keep package upright. When inspected the caps did not appear to be vented, just simple solid plastic. The caps were loose and easily spun when touched. The spill happened when the package was on its side.

item.title: Report E-2024060156
item.description:
Report E-2024060156

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-25
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of ISB-910 was released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improper packaging from the shipper as the handle was broken off and the lid was damaged. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents and place the contents into an 8-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024060096
item.description:
Report X-2024060096

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: package was discovered while loading into a truck it was then investigated and it was found to not have all of the corners clamped down, when discovered that it was leaking it was then moved to an open space until the Manager was able to properly place it in a lined bin and transported to the hazmat area to be processed.
